reviews.review_msg: I would not recommend  her. Her tests are fair, she marks the first assignment easy but she marks papers really hard. Even if you make one honest mistake in a sentence she will accuse you of plagiarizing. This semester she has a stack of assignments that she has reported as "plagiarizing" . She seems like she looks for excuses to report people.

Chantal is a great prof. She cares about her students and is a very nice person. Her tests are very fair and she gives you a list of things to study before the midterm and final so you aren't lost when you study. The downside is that she is a very tough marker when it comes to papers.

Knows her stuff and tries to cover as much material as  possible. However, pace of lecture sometimes too fast, slides not posted online, and some slides have too much text on them making it difficult to read. Paper (book review), tutorial participation marks, presentation on a reading,  mt, and final. Final exam questions heavily based on textbook.

Attendance to lecture is mandatory as she does not post any notes.  Overall, pretty reasonable.  However, she focuses way to much on feminism (which is fine) in moderation.  However, devotes about 80% of the course to it.  Which is a shame, due to the various facets of sociology within law...

Expectations very clear, interesting material, good lecturer, really approachable. I learned a lot in this class & she is probably my favourite prof at SFU so far. Would definitely take another class with her if I could.
Good teacher and really passionate about what she is teaching.  Midterm wasn't too bad, and the assignment was pretty interesting! Would recommend this class!
So far...I've always gotten A- ~ A+ papers... She gave me C.****. She is a nice person though. But really hard marker. Should I get it reevaluated or something?
Her exams are fair and easy. However, she is such a hard marker on term-paper.
She is a sweet, kind and even funny person..Her lectures are very well organized and she records the lectures. Her exams are fair and not hard. I recommend her for sure !
Be warned: she grades very easily on the first assignment, and very difficult on the rest. this strategy really, really screwed me over.

Sweet woman, really passionate about what she's doing. Sometimes her die-hard feminism became a little exhausting, in open-forum converations I detected a bit of scoffing towards some males in the class, simply because they were males. Which wasn't cool. But a very warm woman with lot's of info. You will take many notes in this class.
